description: The Ukrainian solar power sector installed between 800 MW and 850 MW of new capacity in 2024, despite living under a full-scale invasion.

A new law that will significantly improve the grid connection of renewables was approved by the Ukraine's parliament, the Verkhovna Rada, on January 14, 2025.
The plan sets a national goal for achieving 24 GW of renewable energy generation capacity and a 27% share of renewable energy in gross final energy consumption.
In 2024, Ukraine added approximately 800–850 MW of solar power capacity through installations by businesses and households, according to Vladyslav Sokolovsky.
